channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports

item.title: Report E-2024100737
item.description:
Report E-2024100737

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-15T00:55:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-23
  • City: GRANTS
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: MARATHON PETROLEUM COMPANY LP
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 190622
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Driving westbound on I-40W, the driver encountered stopped traffic and did not have sufficient time to stop. The transport left the highway, went into the median, rolled over, and ended up in the median on its passenger side. The truck did not collide with any of the stopped vehicles. 10 gallons were released to the ground and the rest of the material was transferred.

item.title: Report E-2024080377
item.description:
Report E-2024080377

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-15T00:55:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-22
  • City: Clifton
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: BRENNTAG NORTHEAST, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 1
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 13250000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: BNE Driver was involved in fatal vehicle accident while traveling east bound on NJ Route 3 (Clifton, NJ), -Lat 40.8673383, Long -74.184025479. At the time of the accident the EE was driving BNE tractor #476 and loaded BNE van trailer #159. After coming in contact with a NJ Transit Bus, the vehicle went off the right side of the roadway, struck the guardrail, and went through a sound barrier wall creating a fire engulfing the tractor, spreading to the trailer, and resulted in fire and two explosions of onboard hazmat (various flammable liquids, and corrosive) freight. The EE succumbed to their injuries. Roadway was closed for several hours and Local Clifton Fire Dept was able to extinguish the fire of the vehicle, trailer and freight. First Call Environmental (ER/Environmental) contractor was able to contain, remediate, and clean-up the affected areas impacted by fire and release of hazmat at direction of EPA and NJDEP.

item.title: Report I-2024070112
item.description:
Report I-2024070112

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-15T00:55:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-17
  • City: RIVERDALE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: EAST PENN LOGISTICS LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 1
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 313220
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: An East Penn Manufacturing Co. driver was heading west bound on Kamm Ave approaching Jameson Ave. The other driver was headed northbound on Jameson Ave. approaching Kamm Ave. The other driver disregarded the posted stop sign and came into the path of the East Penn driver. Collision occurred and the East Penn truck rolled on to its side and came to a final stop at the northwest corner of the intersection. This was a T-Bone event. Police came to the scene and requested help for the cleanup. East Penn hired a hazardous waste cleanup contractor to clean up the batteries that were on the ground and take them back to their shop. East Penn then went back to the contractor to pick up the batteries to take them back to East Penn's Salt Lake City, UT facility. The batteries were then sent to one of the East Penn's tolling smelters for proper disposal of the batteries at a secondary lead smelter for recycle. East Penn also hired a contractor to do the remediation cleanup of the soil and incident area. The clean up was completed and overseen by the Fresno County Enviromental Health.
